Player would like to join the first available session of the type. If there is no available public session,
and the type allows it, the player would like to have a new session created for them and join it.

Create an event in the log for this session.
Internal session operations will create new events that are accessible from the get request.

Player clients and instances are expected to create events here when something occurs on their clients that is
relevant.

cursor.title: Cursor

browser_sessions.title: Browser Sessions
browser_sessions.description: List of sessions in the browser

custom_data.title: Custom Data
custom_data.description: Custom data with the listing of the instance in the Session browser

platform_id.description: Which platform this client is one

input.description: Which input type this client is using

client_version.title: Client Version
client_version.description: String representation of semver for client

client_settings.title: Client Settings
client_settings.description: Which input type and platform the client is using

crossplay_preferences.title: Crossplay Preferences
crossplay_preferences.description: Client's desired crossplay settings to determine which other clients it can play with. If not defined, assumed to be as permissive as possible

session_type.title: Session Type
session_type.description: Type of session client is creating or joining

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: Preferred site for the instance and match to take place in

permitted_platform.description: The platform type that the client is allowed to play with (any, xbox-like only, playstation-like only etc.)

permitted_input.description: The input type that the client is allowed to play with (keyboard and mouse, gamepad, touch input etc.)

instance_id.title: Instance Id
instance_id.description: ID for which instance was marked as FUBAR

error.title: Error

site.title: Site
site.description: What site the failed instance was in

matchmaking_profile_id.title: Matchmaking Profile Id
matchmaking_profile_id.description: ID for which matchmaking profile was used to generate the failed instance

instance_source_provider.description: Which instance provider allocated this failed instance

allocation_id.title: Allocation Id
allocation_id.description: Allocation ID for instance that's been spun up

instance_id.title: Instance Id
instance_id.description: Unique ID for the host/session relationship

host_player_id.title: Host Player Id
host_player_id.description: Player ID of the host, if the host type is player

host_player_uuid.description: Player UUID of the host, if the host type is player

host_dedicated_process_id.title: Host Dedicated Process Id
host_dedicated_process_id.description: Unique ID for the process that is running this instance

host_dedicated_server_id.title: Host Dedicated Server Id
host_dedicated_server_id.description: Unique ID for the machine running the instance

join_status.description: Is the instance joinable at this time?

instance_startup_params.description: Parameters used by the host to startup. For UE5 this will contain the map and gamemode

version.description: Product Client Version number.  Used for compatibility checking with players

custom_data.description: Custom data that will be passed to the session during the instance launch request

instance_id.description: Unique ID for the instance, a new one will be generated if not provided

map.description: Name of the map for the instance to spawn with

mode.title: Mode

custom_data.description: Custom data to pass through to the instance

custom_data.description: Custom data to join a instance

map_game_id.title: Map Game Id
map_game_id.description: ID to uniquely identify this map game

map_name.title: Map Name

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Game mode for the instance to spawn in

selection_chance.title: Selection Chance
selection_chance.description: Chance that this map will get selected in a rotation list

custom_data.title: Custom Data
custom_data.description: Custom data to pass through to the instance

map_selection_list_id.title: Map Selection List Id
map_selection_list_id.description: ID to uniquely identify this map selection list

maps.title: Maps
maps.description: List of maps that can be chosen in this selection list

created.title: Time Zone Aware Datetime
created.description: Datetime that enforces that a timezone is given. Unix timestamps are allowed and forced into the UTC time zone

ticket_ids.title: Ticket Ids
ticket_ids.description: List of tickets that were assigned to this match if created by matchmaking

profile_id.title: Profile Id
profile_id.description: ID of the matchmaking profile to join

join_mode.description: What mode to set on the matchmaking profile (normal, backfill etc)

instance_launch_template_id.title: Instance Launch Template Id
instance_launch_template_id.description: Which instance template to use when launching a match in this profile

teams.title: Teams
teams.description: List of teams that are to be invited to session

session_tickets.title: Session Tickets
session_tickets.description: List of sessions and tickets the match was made with. Used to verify this match should still be created

instance_launch_template_id.title: Instance Launch Template Id
instance_launch_template_id.description: Which launch template should be used to request an instance

site_id.title: Site Id
site_id.description: Site to start the instance in

match_id.title: Match Id
match_id.description: Unique ID for this generated match

mmr_group_method.description: What method should be used to calculate a group's MMR based on the individual player's ranks

ruleset.title: Ruleset
ruleset.description: A set of rules that determine whether or not this matchmaking config should be used.

profiles.title: Profiles
profiles.description: A list of which match making profiles are going to be created on the ticket

template_group_id.title: Template Group Id
template_group_id.description: ID for this set of potential matchmaking templates

template_options.title: Template Options
template_options.description: List of the different matchmaking templates that could be used. The config is chosen based on a set of rules in each MatchMakingTemplate object. If there are no rules, it's the default template

required_item_ids.title: Required Item Ids
required_item_ids.description: Set of all the item ids that are required to validate every rule contained in this template group

ticket_id.title: Ticket Id
ticket_id.description: Unique ID for this attempt at matchmaking

platform_id.description: Platform that this session is for

leader.title: Leader
leader.description: Is this player the leader of the platform session?  When setting up the parent session, if all players are from the same platform session, leadership is coordinated

platform_session_type.title: Platform Session Type
platform_session_type.description: Platform-Specific Identifier for the Platform's template

session_ids.title: Session Ids
session_ids.description: Sessions the player is currently a part of for this session type, if any.

pending_invites.title: Pending Invites
pending_invites.description: Pending invites, if any, for the current player in this session type

sessions.title: Sessions
sessions.description: Session associated with this player, and any pending invites

queue_id.title: Queue Id
queue_id.description: ID to uniquely identify this queue

active.title: Active
active.description: Flag for whether or not the queue is active, and can be joined or sessions created from it

ranking_type.title: Ranking Type
ranking_type.description: Which rank this queue should use MMR from to make matches from, and update at the end of match (1v1 MMR or 2v2 MMR for example)

num_sides.title: Num Sides
num_sides.description: The number of sides a game in this queue will have (2 in a 1v1 and 3 in a 1v1v1 for example

max_players_per_side.title: Max Players Per Side
max_players_per_side.description: The maximum number of players that can be on each team

min_players_per_side.title: Min Players Per Side
min_players_per_side.description: The minimum number of players that can be on each team

max_queue_group_size.title: Max Queue Group Size
max_queue_group_size.description: The maximum size of a group that can join this queue

match_making_template_group_id.title: Match Making Template Group Id
match_making_template_group_id.description: ID for which group of matchmaking templates/rules will be used when joining this queue

queue_id.title: Queue Id
queue_id.description: ID of the queue to join

additional_tags.title: Additional Tags
additional_tags.description: Additional tags for open match to search with (see https://openmatch.dev/site/docs/reference/api/#searchfields)

map_preferences.title: Map Preferences
map_preferences.description: List of map preferences in order from most desired, to least desired

ticket_id.title: Ticket Id
ticket_id.description: ID for the newly created match making ticket

determiner.description: Determiner of how many rules must be satisfied in this rulest (all, any, one, none)

status.description: Status that the player would like after the request is complete. Note that some join operations may promote the player from `member` to `leader`

client_settings.title: Client Settings
client_settings.description: Which input type and platform the client is using

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: Which team the player is one

crossplay_preferences.description: Client's desired crossplay settings to determine which other clients it can play with. If not defined, assumed to be as permissive as possible
